Knowing the final temperature distribution \\( u(T,x) \\), is it possible to distinguish whether the changes in the system were due to the original source term \\( S(x) \\), an addition of \\( S_2(x) \\), or modifications in the boundary conditions?
Explanation: The observed temperature distribution at \\( u(T,x) \\) is the result of the cumulative effects of diffusion, original source terms, potential additional source terms, and boundary condition modifications. Deciphering which factors specifically contributed and in what manner from the end result is generally impractical without further detailed information, due to the overlapping influences and the linearity of the heat equation.
